history.content:
According to the Berkeley Academic Guide, CS 61B and CS61C are both prerequisites to CS186. Although we do not enforce prerequisites, it is recommended that you complete them before taking CS186. 

That being said, I am sure other students will have better feedback. So make sure to tag this as "peer-directed" :)

I took 186 concurrently with 61C last fall. As far as necessity of 61C knowledge for 186 goes, the only things that I remember 186 pulled directly from 61C were the topics of caches and bit manipulation. However, bit manipulation is easy to learn on your own and we actually covered caches in 61C at the exact same time that they were introduced in 186, so I was actually more refreshed on them than other students.

With that said, during my semester 186 and 61C project due dates always seemed to be within a day or two of each other so I was swamped with work. Personally, I struggled to handle that workload, but ultimately you have a better gauge of your ability to manage projects.

TL;DR: Taking 61C and 186 concurrently is not a struggle knowledge-wise, but it has the potential to be workload-wise.

Is it better to take 170 in the fall and then 61C concurrently with 186 in the spring, or take 61C in the fall and 170 with 186 in the spring?

I know that 170 is supposed to be useful for interviews, but I've also heard that learning architecture helps a lot. What are some of your thoughts?
history.subject: CS 186 dependent on 61C?
